news_items.headline: Google parent Alphabet loses trillion-dollar status after revenue miss
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc <GOOGL.O> shares fell 4% on Tuesday after the search giant posted its first holiday-quarter revenue miss in five years, even as new disclosures on the company's smaller YouTube unit were warmly welcomed by Wall Street.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The brand logo of Alphabet Inc's Google is seen outside its office in Beijing, China August 8, 2018.  Picture taken with a fisheye lens. REUTERS/Thomas Peter/File Photo

news_items.headline: Alphabet shares fall as Google misses on sales, YouTube revenue disappoints
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's <GOOGL.O> new Chief Executive Sundar Pichai unveiled sales figures that investors have long demanded, but shares fell 5% as Google's advertising business and the new data about YouTube and Google Cloud broadly disappointed.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The new Google Pixel 4 smartphone and accessories are displayed during a Google launch event in New York City, New York, U.S., October 15, 2019. REUTERS/Eduardo Munoz/File Photo

news_items.headline: REFILE-Alphabet records slowest Q4 revenue growth in 5 years
news_items.lede: Google-parent Alphabet Inc on Monday reported its worst fourth-quarter revenue growth since 2015, missing analysts' estimate for a period in which its top online advertising rivals beat expectations.

news_items.headline: Google temporarily shutting down all China offices
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's Google said on Wednesday it is temporarily shutting down all its offices in China due to the outbreak of a new coronavirus in the country.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Google is seen at the high profile startups and high tech leaders gathering, Viva Tech,in Paris, France May 16, 2019. REUTERS/Charles Platiau/File Photo

news_items.headline: Google temporarily shutting down all China offices - The Verge
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's Google is temporarily shutting down all its offices in China due to the outbreak of a new coronavirus in the country, technology website The Verge reported on Wednesday.

news_items.headline: Waymo to test autonomous trucks, vans in Texas and New Mexico
news_items.lede: Waymo, the self-driving unit of Alphabet Inc <GOOGL.O>, said on Thursday it will start testing autonomous trucks and vans in Texas and New Mexico this week.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A Waymo Chrysler Pacifica Hybrid self-driving vehicle is parked and displayed during a demonstration in Chandler, Arizona, November 29, 2018.  REUTERS/Caitlin O’Hara

news_items.headline: Google CEO eyes major opportunity in healthcare, says will protect privacy
news_items.lede: Sundar Pichai, the CEO of Alphabet Inc and its Google subsidiary, said on Wednesday that healthcare offers the biggest potential over the next five to 10 years for using artificial intelligence to improve outcomes, and vowed that the technology giant will heed privacy concerns...
news_items.img_cap: Sundar Pichai, Chief Executive Officer of Alphabet, gestures as he speaks during a session of the 50th World Economic Forum (WEF) annual meeting in Davos, Switzerland, January 22, 2020. REUTERS/Denis Balibouse

news_items.headline: Alphabet public market capitalization tops $1 trillion
news_items.lede: The public market capitalization of Google parent Alphabet <GOOGL.O> topped the $1 trillion mark shortly before the close of trading on Thursday, making it the fourth S&P 500 component to top the lofty level.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Google logo is pictured atop an office building in Irvine, California, U.S. August 7, 2017.   REUTERS/Mike Blake

news_items.headline: Alphabet legal head Drummond exits, giving its new CEO chance to shake up team
news_items.lede: Alphabet's new Chief Executive Sundar Pichai on Friday gained the opportunity to reshape the leadership of Google's parent with the exit of Chief Legal Officer David Drummond, whose outsized strategic role was overshadowed by employee concerns about his personal relationship...
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Google Executive Chairman Eric Schmidt (L) and David Drummond, Google's Senior Vice President of Corporate Development, react before a meeting about the "right to be forgotten" in Madrid September 9, 2014.  REUTERS/Andrea Comas (SPAIN)

news_items.headline: Alphabet's legal head David Drummond to retire this month
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc said on Friday its Chief Legal Officer David Drummond will be retiring from the company effective Jan. 31. (https://bit.ly/39YWUpl) (Reporting by Munsif Vengattil in Bengaluru; Editing by Shounak Dasgupta)

news_items.headline: Waymo secures bigger award against workers who went to rival Uber
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's Waymo said on Thursday that arbitrators had finalized a judgment of $128 million, plus undisclosed legal costs and interest, against two former employees who went to rival Uber Technologies Inc.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A Waymo Chrysler Pacifica Hybrid self-driving vehicle is parked and displayed during a demonstration in Chandler, Arizona, November 29, 2018.  REUTERS/Caitlin O’Hara

news_items.headline: Waymo self-driving vehicles cover 20 million miles on public roads
news_items.lede: Waymo, the self-driving unit of Alphabet Inc <GOOGL.O>, said its vehicles had covered more than 20 million miles (32.2 million km) on public roads since its creation in 2009.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Reuters reporter Alexandria Sage steps out of a Waymo self-driving vehicle during a demonstration in Chandler, Arizona, November 29, 2018. REUTERS/Caitlin O’Hara

news_items.headline: US STOCKS-Alphabet, Amazon keep S&P afloat as Middle East tensions persist
news_items.lede: * Indexes: Dow off 0.10%, S&P up 0.07%, Nasdaq gains 0.24% (For a live blog on the U.S. stock market, click or type LIVE/ in a news window)

news_items.headline: US STOCKS-Alphabet, Amazon keep S&P afloat as Middle East tensions persist
news_items.lede: * Indexes: Dow off 0.17%, S&P flat, Nasdaq up 0.17% (For a live blog on the U.S. stock market, click or type LIVE/ in a news window)

news_items.headline: Google to end 'Double Irish, Dutch sandwich' tax scheme
news_items.lede: Google parent Alphabet <GOOGL.O> will no longer use an intellectual property licensing scheme, known as the "Double Irish, Dutch sandwich", which allowed it to delay paying U.S. taxes, 2018 tax filings show.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Google is seen at the high profile startups and high tech leaders gathering, Viva Tech,in Paris, France May 16, 2019. REUTERS/Charles Platiau/File Photo

news_items.headline: Google to end "Double Irish, Dutch" tax scheme - filing
news_items.lede: Alphabet, the parent company of Google, will no longer use the intellectual property licensing scheme commonly known as the "Double Irish, Dutch sandwich", according to 2018 tax filings with the Irish and Dutch governments seen by Reuters.

news_items.headline: Alphabet grants Pichai largest ever stock award, again
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's newly-instated Chief Executive Officer Sundar Pichai would receive a hefty $240 million in performance-based stock awards over the next three years, the highest ever promised to any executive of the search giant.

news_items.headline: J&J to buy remaining stake in Verb Surgical to strengthen digital surgery portfolio
news_items.lede: Johnson & Johnson said on Friday it would acquire the remaining stake in Verb Surgical Inc, from Verily, Alphabet Inc's life sciences division.
news_items.img_cap: The company logo for Johnson & Johnson is displayed on a screen to celebrate the 75th anniversary of the company's listing at the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, U.S., September 17, 2019. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid

news_items.headline: Alphabet's Loon agrees airspace deal with Uganda for internet balloon service
news_items.lede: Loon, a unit of Google's owner Alphabet Inc, which uses high-altitude balloons to provide mobile internet to remote areas, has signed a key access airspace agreement with Uganda.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A Loon internet balloon, carrying solar-powered mobile networking equipment flies over the company's launch site in Winnemucca, Nevada, U.S., in this photo provided June 27, 2019.   Courtesy Loon/Handout via REUTERS.

news_items.headline: Alphabet names Nobel Prize winner Frances Arnold to board
news_items.lede: Google parent Alphabet Inc on Monday named Noble Prize winner Frances Arnold to its board, filling a vacancy left by the retirement of fellow academic Shirley Tilghman.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Professor Frances H. Arnold,  Nobel Prize laureate in chemistry attends a news conference at the Royal Academy of Science in Stockholm, Sweden December 7, 2018. TT News Agency/Claudio Bresciani via REUTERS

news_items.headline: Labor group accuses Google of firing 4 to deter workers from union activities
news_items.lede: The Communications Workers of America union filed a federal labor charge against Alphabet Inc's Google on Thursday, accusing the company of unlawfully firing four employees to deter workers from engaging in union activities.

news_items.headline: Factbox: Alphabet's 'Other bets' in focus as Google's Pichai takes helm
news_items.lede: Google Chief Executive Officer Sundar Pichai will replace Larry Page as CEO of parent Alphabet Inc, heralding a new chapter for the company that helped reshape the global tech industry under its co-founders Page and Sergey Brin.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A sign is pictured outs a Google offcie near the company's headquarters in Mountain View, California, U.S., May 8, 2019.   REUTERS/Dave Paresh

news_items.headline: Google co-founders step aside as Pichai takes helm of parent Alphabet
news_items.lede: Google co-founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin are stepping aside as leaders of the Internet behemoth they founded 21 years ago, ending an extraordinary run that saw them build one of the world's most valuable and influential companies.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Google CEO Sundar Pichai speaks during signing ceremony committing Google to help expand information technology education at El Centro College in Dallas, Texas, U.S. October 3, 2019.  REUTERS/Brandon Wade

news_items.headline: Alphabet's Waymo expands app to iPhone devices in Phoenix
news_items.lede: Ride-hailing company Waymo said on Thursday its app will now be available to iPhone users in Phoenix, Arizona.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A Waymo employee hails a ride during a demonstration in Chandler, Arizona, November 29, 2018. Picture taken November 29, 2018. REUTERS/Caitlin O’Hara

news_items.headline: Warren calls for Larry Page testimony, despite change of guard at Alphabet
news_items.lede: United States Senator Elizabeth Warren said on Wednesday that she still expects Larry Page to testify in Congress, a day after he stepped down as chief executive of Alphabet Inc <GOOGL.O>, Google's parent company.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Sen. Elizabeth Warren holds a town hall event in West Des Moines, Iowa, U.S. November 25, 2019.  REUTERS/Scott Morgan

news_items.headline: Under Pichai, Alphabet's moonshot projects may face more scrutiny
news_items.lede: Alphabet's <GOOGL.O> leadership change has some investors hoping that the owner of Google will take a hard look at the cash-burning ventures championed by its founders.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Google CEO Sundar Pichai speaks during signing ceremony committing Google to help expand information technology education at El Centro College in Dallas, Texas, U.S. October 3, 2019.  REUTERS/Brandon Wade/File Photo

news_items.headline: Factbox: New Alphabet chief started at Google, made name with Android
news_items.lede: Google Chief Executive Officer Sundar Pichai will replace company co-founder Larry Page as CEO of parent Alphabet Inc, the company said in a blog post on Tuesday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Google CEO Sundar Pichai attends a news conference during the opening of the new Alphabet's Google Berlin office in Berlin, Germany, January 22, 2019. REUTERS/Hannibal Hanschke/File Photo

news_items.headline: Alphabet's new CEO Pichai now sole target on Google regulatory battles
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's new chief executive, Sundar Pichai, will have the hot seat all to himself as regulators around the world investigate the company, U.S. politicians demand that it be broken up, and President Donald Trump accuses it of aiding his rivals.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: White House adviser Ivanka Trump, right, and Google CEO Sundar Pichai attend a roundtable at El Centro College in Dallas, Texas, U.S. October 3, 2019.  REUTERS/Brandon Wade

news_items.headline: Alphabet's new CEO Pichai now sole target on Google regulatory battles
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's new chief executive, Sundar Pichai, will have the hot seat all to himself as regulators around the world investigate the company, U.S. politicians demand that it be broken up, and President Donald Trump accuses it of aiding his rivals.

news_items.headline: Breakingviews - Google CEO move is solution in search of a problem
news_items.lede: The reshuffle of chief executives at Google and parent Alphabet is something of a solution in search of a problem. Sundar Pichai, who runs the search engine, will now also lead the $890 billion Alphabet, replacing Larry Page. Sergey Brin, Page’s fellow co-founder, will step...
news_items.img_cap: Google CEO Sundar Pichai speaks during signing ceremony committing Google to help expand information technology education at El Centro College in Dallas, Texas, U.S. October 3, 2019. REUTERS/Brandon Wade

news_items.headline: Google chief Pichai takes helm of parent Alphabet as co-founders step aside
news_items.lede: Google Chief Executive Sundar Pichai will replace company co-founder Larry Page as CEO of parent Alphabet Inc, the company said in a blog post on Tuesday.

news_items.headline: Google to let sites block personalized ads under California privacy law
news_items.lede: Websites and apps using Google's advertising tools will be able to block personalized ads to internet users in California and elsewhere as part of the Alphabet Inc unit's effort to help them comply with the state's new privacy law, it told clients this week.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Google logo is pictured atop an office building in Irvine, California, U.S. August 7, 2017.   REUTERS/Mike Blake

news_items.headline: U.S. lawmakers question Google about collection of health records
news_items.lede: U.S. Presidential candidate Elizabeth Warren along with fellow Senators Richard Blumenthal and Bill Cassidy wrote a letter to Alphabet's Google on Wednesday to raise questions about its access to the health records of tens of millions of Americans.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: People pass by an entrance to Google offices in New York, U.S., June 4, 2019. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid/File Photo

news_items.headline: U.S. Congress seeks answers on patient privacy in Google, Ascension cloud deal
news_items.lede: Four Democratic leaders on the U.S. House of Representatives Energy and Commerce committee on Monday wrote Alphabet Inc's Google and Ascension Health demanding briefings by Dec. 6 on how patient data the hospital chain is storing on the cloud is used.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: An illuminated Google logo is seen inside an office building in Zurich, Switzerland December 5, 2018.    REUTERS/Arnd Wiegmann/File Photo

news_items.headline: Factbox: Technology for Alphabet's futuristic smart city dream in Toronto
news_items.lede: Alphabet's <GOOGL.O> Sidewalk Labs released a detailed overview on Friday of the futuristic technology it intends to incorporate in the smart city it wants to build in Toronto.

news_items.headline: Google antitrust probe to expand into Android: CNBC
news_items.lede: The several dozen attorneys general investigating advertising practices at Alphabet Inc's <GOOGL.O> Google are planning to expand their antitrust probe into the unit's flagship Android business, CNBC reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: An illuminated Google logo is seen inside an office building in Zurich, Switzerland December 5, 2018.    REUTERS/Arnd Wiegmann/File Photo

news_items.headline: Regulators begin probe into Google-Ascension cloud computing deal: WSJ
news_items.lede: A U.S. federal regulator has initiated an investigation into a cloud computing deal between Alphabet Inc's Google and Ascension Health [ASCNH.UL] which would give Google access to detailed health information of millions of patients, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday...
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A sign is pictured outs a Google office near the company's headquarters in Mountain View, California, U.S., May 8, 2019.  REUTERS/Dave Paresh/File Photo/File Photo

news_items.headline: Google launches smart device in Brazil in new challenge to Amazon
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc’s Google is bringing to Brazil the latest version of its own smart device Google Nest, with plans to start selling it in major online and brick-and-mortar retailers in the country as of Tuesday.

news_items.headline: Alphabet expects to complete probe of sexual misconduct claims by next month
news_items.lede: The board of Google parent Alphabet Inc <GOOGL.O> expects to complete by next month an investigation into the company's handling of sexual harassment and other misconduct complaints against current and former executives, according to a filing in state court last month.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A sign is pictured outs a Google office near the company's headquarters in Mountain View, California, U.S., May 8, 2019.  REUTERS/Dave Paresh

news_items.headline: Alphabet board probes company's handling of sexual misconduct allegations
news_items.lede: The board of Google parent company Alphabet Inc is investigating executives' handling of sexual harassment and other misconduct claims, and expects to complete its probe by early December, according to a recent court filing.

news_items.headline: Alphabet's Google to buy Fitbit for $2.1 bln
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's Google will buy wearable device maker Fitbit Inc for $2.1 billion, as the search giant looks to enter the fast-growing market for fitness trackers and smartwatches.

news_items.headline: Alphabet's Sidewalk Labs secures conditional nod for Toronto smart city
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's Sidewalk Labs unit secured conditional approval to move forward in the process to build a smart city in Toronto after agreeing to develop a smaller area than initially proposed and make concessions on data collection and privacy, the city's waterfront development...
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The downtown skyline and CN Tower are seen past cranes in the waterfront area envisioned by Alphabet Inc's Sidewalk Labs as a new technical hub in the Port Lands district of Toronto, Ontario, Canada March 29, 2019. REUTERS/Chris Helgren/File Photo

news_items.headline: Australian regulator files privacy suit against Google alleging location data misuse
news_items.lede: An Australian regulator has filed a lawsuit against Alphabet Inc's Google, accusing it of misleading smartphone users about how it collected and used personal location data, advancing a global crackdown on the world's biggest tech firms.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A sign is pictured outs a Google office near the company's headquarters in Mountain View, California, U.S., May 8, 2019.  REUTERS/Dave Paresh

news_items.headline: Breakingviews - Alphabet at risk of middle-aged M&A spread
news_items.lede: Alphabet still runs fast, but its pace is slowing. It’s a common problem that comes with aging. A potential bid for device-maker Fitbit could bring new youthful energy for the $880 billion firm, or just a slightly expanded waistline.
news_items.img_cap: An illuminated Google logo is seen inside an office building in Zurich September 5, 2018. REUTERS/Arnd WIegmann

news_items.headline: Alphabet third-quarter profit misses estimates
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc fell short of analysts' estimates for third-quarter profit on Monday, hit by aggressive spending by its Google unit on marketing and hardware development.

news_items.headline: Exclusive: U.S. states plan Google antitrust meeting next month in Colorado - sources
news_items.lede: U.S. state attorneys general probing Alphabet's Google plan to meet next month in Colorado to discuss a probe into whether the search giant's business practices break antitrust law, according to three sources knowledgeable about the meeting.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A Google sign is seen during the WAIC (World Artificial Intelligence Conference) in Shanghai, China, September 17, 2018. REUTERS/Aly Song

news_items.headline: Google, Reddit defend tech legal protections ahead of Congress hearing
news_items.lede: A 23-year-old law giving technology companies legal protection from lawsuits over user-generated content remains critical to the internet's future, Alphabet Inc's <GOOGL.O> Google unit and social media site Reddit Inc said in testimony released on Tuesday.
news_items.img_cap: The new Google Pixel 4 smartphone and accessories are displayed during a Google launch event in New York City, New York, U.S., October 15, 2019. REUTERS/Eduardo Munoz

news_items.headline: House investigators say they have begun receiving data from big tech firms
news_items.lede: The leaders of the House of Representatives Judiciary Committee said late on Tuesday that they had begun receiving data from Facebook, Alphabet's Google, Amazon and Apple as part of their probe into the companies' potential breaches of antitrust law.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logos of Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Google are seen in a combination photo from Reuters files. REUTERS//File Photo

news_items.headline: Google unveils mid-tier Pixelbook Go laptop, wireless earbuds
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's Google on Tuesday unveiled a new mid-tier laptop aimed at users on the go, the first of several big announcements expected at the company's annual hardware launch event.

news_items.headline: Google to triple cloud computing workforce in Latin America by end of 2020
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's Google expects to triple its customer workforce to support cloud computing services in Latin America by the end of next year, Google Cloud's director in Brazil, João Bolonha, said on Thursday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Google is seen at the high profile startups and high tech leaders gathering, Viva Tech,in Paris, France May 16, 2019. REUTERS/Charles Platiau/File Photo

news_items.headline: Google pulls Hong Kong protester role-playing app
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's Google has suspended a role-playing app associated with the Hong Kong protests due to a policy that prohibits developers capitalizing on ongoing conflicts, the company said on Thursday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Small toy figures are seen in front of Google logo in this illustration picture, April 8, 2019. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo

news_items.headline: Website that allowed Huawei phones to install Google apps taken down
news_items.lede: A China-based website that allowed for manual installation of Google's Android apps on Huawei's newly launched Mate 30 devices went offline on Wednesday after a security researcher highlighted the "backdoor" to sidestep a U.S. ban.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A new Huawei Mate 30 smartphone is pictured at the Convention Center in Munich, Germany September 19, 2019. REUTERS/Michael Dalder/File Photo

news_items.headline: Google offers incognito mode for Maps in privacy push
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's Google is rolling out new privacy features to its Maps, YouTube and Voice Assistant services, with options including incognito mode and automatic data deletion, the company said on Wednesday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Google logo is pictured at the entrance to the Google offices in London, Britain January 18, 2019. REUTERS/Hannah McKay/File Photo

news_items.headline: Huawei phones lose access to install Google's apps - Bloomberg
news_items.lede: Huawei Technologies Co Ltd's newly launched Mate 30 devices have lost their access to manually install Google's Android apps, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday.

news_items.headline: Google to stop showing news snippets for French users
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's Google will stop showing news snippets from European publishers on search results for its French users, complying with a new European copyright law, the company said on Wednesday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Visitors pass by the logo of Google at the high profile startups and high tech leaders gathering, Viva Tech,in Paris, France May 16, 2019. REUTERS/Charles Platiau/File Photo

news_items.headline: Google launches subscription service for select apps and games
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's Google <GOOGL.O> said on Monday it is rolling out Google Play Pass, a subscription service that gives Android users access to more than 350 apps and games without ads and in-app purchases.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Visitors pass by the logo of Google at the high profile startups and high tech leaders gathering, Viva Tech,in Paris, France May 16, 2019. REUTERS/Charles Platiau/File Photo

news_items.headline: Alphabet unit to make drone deliveries for Walgreens, FedEx in the U.S.
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's aviation unit Wing said on Thursday it has partnered with Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc and FedEx Corp for deliveries directly to homes in Virginia using drones, beginning next month.

news_items.headline: Waymo eyes deploying self-driving technology in trucking: CEO Krafcik
news_items.lede: Waymo is exploring deploying its self-driving technology in the trucking industry, CEO John Krafcik said on Thursday, as it works with industry partners to seize a commercial opportunity from a looming shortage of human drivers.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Waymo CEO John Krafcik speaks on stage during the annual Google I/O developers conference in Mountain View, California, May 8, 2018. REUTERS/Stephen Lam

news_items.headline: U.S. social media firms to testify on violent, extremist online content
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's Google, Facebook Inc and Twitter Inc will testify next week before a U.S. Senate panel on efforts by social media firms to remove violent content from online platforms, the panel said in a statement on Wednesday.
news_items.img_cap: The Twitter App loads on an iPhone in this illustration photograph taken in Los Angeles, California, U.S., July 22, 2019.    REUTERS/Mike Blake

news_items.headline: Apple disputes Google security researcher findings on iPhone attack
news_items.lede: Apple Inc on Friday disputed the way that researchers at Alphabet Inc's cybersecurity team characterized an iPhone security flaw that they said could be used to track users of the smartphone in real time.

news_items.headline: GM will use Google to power future infotainment systems
news_items.lede: General Motors Co<GM.N> will use embedded Google technology to power navigation, voice activated controls and other vehicle infotainment functions starting in 2021, in a win for Alphabet Inc <GOOGL.O> in the race with Amazon.com and other technology companies to control...
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The GM logo is seen at the General Motors plant in Sao Jose dos Campos, Brazil, January 22, 2019. REUTERS/Roosevelt Cassio

news_items.headline: Google target of new antitrust probe by state attorneys general - Washington Post
news_items.lede: More than half of U.S. state attorneys general are readying an investigation into Alphabet Inc's Google for potential antitrust violations, the Washington Post reported on Tuesday.

news_items.headline: Google to pay up to $200 mln to FTC on YouTube probe - Politico
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's Google will pay in the range of $150 million to $200 million to settle the Federal Trade Commission's investigation into YouTube's alleged violation of a certain children's privacy law, Politico reported on Friday.

news_items.headline: Huawei plans high-end phone launch under cloud of Google ban
news_items.lede: Huawei Technologies plans to forge ahead with the launch of new high-end smartphones in Europe even though it may not be able to offer Google's official Android operating system and widely used apps such as Google Maps, company executives told Reuters.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A Huawei company logo is pictured at the Shenzhen International Airport in Shenzhen, Guangdong province, China July 22, 2019. REUTERS/Aly Song

news_items.headline: CORRECTED-Huawei plans high-end phone launch under cloud of Google ban
news_items.lede: Huawei Technologies plans to forge ahead with the launch of new high-end smartphones in Europe even though it may not be able to offer Google's official Android operating system and widely used apps such as Google Maps, company executives told Reuters.

news_items.headline: Google to move Pixel smartphone production to Vietnam: Nikkei
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's <GOOGL.O> Google is shifting its Pixel smartphone production to Vietnam from China starting this year as it builds a cheap supply chain in Southeast Asia, the Nikkei business daily reported on Wednesday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: People try out Google's Pixel 2 phones during a launch event in San Francisco, California, U.S. October 4, 2017. REUTERS/Stephen Lam

news_items.headline: Timeline: Autonomous car pioneer Levandowski faces criminal charges of stealing from Alphabet
news_items.lede: The U.S. Department of Justice on Tuesday filed criminal charges against Anthony Levandowski, accusing the former high-ranking Alphabet Inc <GOOGL.O> engineer of stealing the company's self-driving car technology before joining rival Uber Technologies Inc <UBER.N>.
news_items.img_cap: Former Google and Uber engineer Anthony Levandowski leaves the federal court after his arraignment hearing in San Jose, California, U.S. August 27, 2019.  REUTERS/Stephen Lam

news_items.headline: UPDATE 2-U.S. charges ex-Alphabet engineer with stealing self-driving car secrets
news_items.lede: The U.S. Department of Justice on Tuesday filed criminal charges accusing Anthony Levandowski, a former high-ranking engineer at Alphabet Inc, of stealing the company's self-driving car technology before joining rival Uber Technologies Inc.

news_items.headline: U.S. charges Levandowski with stealing Alphabet trade secrets
news_items.lede: The U.S. Department of Justice on Tuesday filed criminal charges against Anthony Levandowski, accusing the former high-ranking Alphabet Inc engineer of stealing the company's self-driving car technology before joining rival Uber Technologies Inc. (Reporting by Daniel Levine...

news_items.headline: News Corp developing 'Knewz.com' service to take on Google News: WSJ
news_items.lede: News Corp <NWSA.O> is developing a news-aggregation service to compete with Alphabet Inc's <GOOGL.O> Google News and could be launched later this year, the Wall Street Journal reported citing people familiar with the matter.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The News Corporation logo on their headquarters building, home to Fox News, is seen in Manhattan, New York, U.S., July 6, 2016. REUTERS/Mike Segar/File Photo

news_items.headline: AMD lands Google, Twitter as customers with newest server chip
news_items.lede: Advanced Micro Devices Inc on Wednesday released the second generation of its processor chip for data centers and said that it had landed Alphabet Inc' Google and Twitter Inc as customers.

news_items.headline: Google pledges carbon-neutral shipping, recycled plastic for all devices
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's <GOOGL.O> Google on Monday announced that it would neutralize carbon emissions from delivering consumer hardware by next year and include recycled plastic in each of its products by 2022.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Google logo is pictured at the entrance to the Google offices in London, Britain January 18, 2019. REUTERS/Hannah McKay/File Photo

news_items.headline: Google suspends transcription of voice assistant clips in Europe
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's Google <GOOGL.O> has suspended reviewing voice recordings from its Google Assistant virtual helper in the European Union after a leak of Dutch audio data, a company spokeswoman told Reuters on Thursday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A sign is pictured outside a Google office near the company's headquarters in Mountain View, California, U.S., May 8, 2019. REUTERS/Dave Paresh/File Photo

news_items.headline: Google suspends transcriptions from voice assistant recordings in Europe-CNBC
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's Google has suspended producing transcriptions of voice recordings from its Google Assistant product in the European Union, CNBC reported https://www.cnbc.com/2019/08/01/google-suspends-transcriptions-of-recordings-from-voice-assistant-in-eu.html?__source=twitter...

news_items.headline: Alphabet, Starbucks drive Wall Street to record high
news_items.lede: (This July 26 story fixes spelling of company name in paragraph 12)
news_items.img_cap: Traders work on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, U.S., July 25, 2019. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid

news_items.headline: REFILE-US STOCKS-Alphabet, Starbucks send Wall Street to record high
news_items.lede: Robust earnings from Alphabet and Starbucks pushed the S&P 500 and Nasdaq indexes to record highs on Friday, with support from data showing U.S. economic growth slowed less than expected in the second quarter.

news_items.headline: Australia shares set to start week higher; NZ gains
news_items.lede: Australian shares were set to open higher on Monday, tracking Wall Street indexes which rose to record highs after robust earnings from Alphabet and Starbucks. The upbeat earnings sent the S&P 500 and Nasdaq soaring on Friday, with support from data which showed U.S. economic...

news_items.headline: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-S&P, Nasdaq hit closing records with help from Alphabet, Starbucks
news_items.lede: Robust earnings from Alphabet and Starbucks pushed the S&P 500 and Nasdaq indexes to record highs on Friday, with support from data showing U.S. economic growth slowed less than expected in the second quarter.

news_items.headline: US STOCKS-S&P 500, Nasdaq hit record high on upbeat Alphabet earnings, GDP data
news_items.lede: * Indexes up: Dow 0.15%, S&P 0.67%, Nasdaq 1.06% (Updates to early afternoon)

news_items.headline: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Alphabet, Intel earnings boost Wall Street at open
news_items.lede: Wall Street's main indexes opened higher on Friday, as robust earnings from Google-owner Alphabet and Intel spurred a rally in technology stocks and data showed the U.S. economy slowed less than expected in the second quarter.

news_items.headline: Alphabet shares jump 9% on ad rebound, cloud promise
news_items.lede: Shares of Alphabet Inc <GOOGL.O> rose nearly 9% in premarket trading on Friday, after the company handily beat Wall Street targets on higher ad sales and touted growth at its cloud unit, a high-margin business it is leaning more on to drive growth.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A sign is pictured outs a Google offcie near the company's headquarters in Mountain View, California, U.S., May 8, 2019.  Photo taken May 8, 2019.  REUTERS/Dave Paresh

news_items.headline: Alphabet says to continue talks with DoJ in antitrust review
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc on Thursday acknowledged a broader U.S. Department of Justice antitrust review of large technology firms and said it will continue to engage with the regulator.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A sign is pictured outside a Google office near the company's headquarters in Mountain View, California, U.S., May 8, 2019.  REUTERS/Dave Paresh/File Photo

news_items.headline: Alphabet's revenue rebounds; easing doubts on growth and boosting shares
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc shares rose about 8% after the company reported quarterly results that eased investors' concerns about growth challenges facing its Google advertising business.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Small toy figures are seen in front of Google logo in this illustration picture, April 8, 2019. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo

news_items.headline: Alphabet second-quarter revenue beats estimates
news_items.lede: Google-parent Alphabet Inc beat Wall Street estimates for quarterly revenue on Thursday, benefiting from advertisers spending more on its search and YouTube services.

news_items.headline: Google accused of ripping off digital ad technology in U.S. lawsuit
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's Google LLC was hit on Monday with a U.S. lawsuit alleging it copied a smaller firm's patented digital advertising technology.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Google logo is pictured at the entrance to the Google offices in London, Britain January 18, 2019. REUTERS/Hannah McKay

news_items.headline: Big Tech executives due on Capitol Hill next week for antitrust hearing
news_items.lede: Executives from Amazon.com Inc, Apple Inc, Facebook Inc and Alphabet's Google will testify before a House of Representatives congressional committee next week in a hearing to discuss the tremendous market power wielded by online platforms.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logos of Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Google are seen in a combination photo from Reuters files.    REUTERS/File Photos

news_items.headline: Big tech execs headed to Capitol Hill for antitrust hearing next week
news_items.lede: Executives from Amazon.com Inc, Apple Inc, Facebook Inc and Alphabet's Google will testify before a House congressional committee next week in a hearing to discuss the tremendous market power wielded by online platforms.

news_items.headline: Google announces new subsea cable 'Equiano', connecting Africa and Europe
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's Google on Friday announced a new subsea cable dubbed "Equiano" that will connect Africa with Europe, as it boosts its cloud computing infrastructure.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Google logo is pictured at the entrance to the Google offices in London, Britain January 18, 2019. REUTERS/Hannah McKay/File Photo

news_items.headline: Google Cloud absorbs Alphabet cybersecurity firm Chronicle
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc announced on Thursday that its year-old cybersecurity company, Chronicle, would be absorbed by its Google Cloud division because customers have been seeking an integrated offering.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Google logo is pictured at the entrance to the Google offices in London, Britain January 18, 2019. REUTERS/Hannah McKay/File Photo

news_items.headline: Factbox: Alphabet unveils Toronto smart city master plan details
news_items.lede: Alphabet on Monday released details of a proposed smart city development for Toronto, outlining plans in a 1,500 page document. Sidewalk Labs CEO Dan Doctoroff said at a press conference that Sidewalk Labs, an Alphabet unit, will not disclose personal information to third...
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The downtown skyline and CN Tower are seen past the eastern waterfront area envisioned by Alphabet Inc's Sidewalk Labs as a new technical hub in the Port Lands district of Toronto, Ontario, Canada April 3, 2019.  REUTERS/Chris Helgren/File Photo

news_items.headline: Activists urge Google to break up before regulators force it to
news_items.lede: Shareholder activists on Wednesday urged Google parent Alphabet Inc to break itself up before regulators force the world's biggest internet ad seller to split into different pieces.
news_items.img_cap: Alphabet employees, community organizers and human rights activists gather for a rally after an annual shareholder meeting outside of the Google Cloud computing unit's headquarters in Sunnyvale, California, U.S., June 19, 2019.  REUTERS/Dave Paresh Ê

news_items.headline: Activists urge Google to break up before regulators force it to
news_items.lede: Shareholder activists want Google parent Alphabet Inc to break itself up before regulators force the world's biggest internet ad seller to split into different pieces.

news_items.headline: Google calendar app down globally
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's Google Calendar app users were unable to access their schedules on Tuesday as the app faced technical issues globally.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Google's logo is seen at Viva Tech fair in Paris, France May 16, 2019. REUTERS/Charles Platiau/File Photo

news_items.headline: Google flags U.S. national security risks from Huawei ban: FT
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's Google has warned if the U.S. administration moves ahead with sweeping ban on Huawei Technologies Co Ltd, it risks compromising national security, the Financial Times reported on Thursday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: An illuminated Google logo is seen inside an office building in Zurich, Switzerland December 5, 2018. REUTERS/Arnd Wiegmann/File Photo

news_items.headline: U.S. antitrust probe to be credit negative for Google - Moody's
news_items.lede: Ratings agency Moody's Investor Service said on Wednesday that reports of U.S. agencies probing the business practices and market position of Alphabet Inc's Google are credit negative for the technology giant.

news_items.headline: Alphabet shares slide 6% on possible DoJ antitrust probe
news_items.lede: Alphabet Inc's shares closed 6% down on Monday following reports that the U.S. Justice Department may investigate Google for hampering competition.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A sign is pictured outs a Google offcie near the company's headquarters in Mountain View, California, U.S., May 8, 2019.  REUTERS/Dave Paresh
